build i0130-1130, winxp, j9sc20031212

Sorry, no steps. I had a lot of things go wrong at once so I exited Eclipse.
Then I noticed the following in my log file. I reverted back to yesterday's
build and noticed that my coolbars were no longer "locked" and thought it could
be related.

This is really bad for me. JDK 1.4.2 WinXp
Attempted to do JUnit plugin testing with the Junit view as a fastview. BOOM. 
30 to 40 NPE in the log, CPU pegged. Took about 15 minutes for me to wrestle 
back my Eclipse session.

This is really annoying for me as I need, each time this NPE occurs, to close 
and restart my workspace. Because I'm working in Synchro view for a merge 
action, automatic synchro restart each time I open my workspace and makes me 
waste lot of time. Merge action does not need anything else to be long and 
boring...
Isn't there any other workaround than go back to previous working integration 
build?
*** Bug 51251 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 51279 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Happens to me as well using I20040205.

It seems to be happening more frequently since 20040205.  I can't go more than
10-15 minutes without restarting now.

In a conversation, she says that switching between the Team Synchronize
perspective and the Java perspective are a potential trigger.

This is a general appeal for help: does anyone have a reproducible case for this
exception?

Try this...this seems to work for me some of the time:

Have no open editors
Open the synchronize perspective
open a java editor
open a plugin manifest editor
switch to the java editor and close it rapidly.

Could it be that one thread is calling dispose while another is calling fill()?

I saw this very soon after starting, using I20040105.

I had many similar stack traces in the log.
Two different NPE stack traces in ToolBarContributionItem are as follows.
See also the 3rd one which occurs a bit later in OpenInCompareAction.run

I've just placed an interim solution into CVS (to be picked up in tonight's 0010
M7 test candidate).  The fix is not a final solution but should do two things:
1.) Provide a more stable platform for those people experiencing the problem.
2.) Provide me with more information about what is actually happening.

I've added a debugging option that while help track down exactly why this NPE is
happening.  I'd appreciate if those of you who have been seeing this problem
could run with this debugging option and let me know if anything appears on stdout.

org.eclipse.ui/debug=true
org.eclipse.jface/trace/toolbarDisposal=true


For those that don't know, specifying "-debug /path/to/filename" on the
command-line tells Eclipse where to look for debugging options.  The file itself
is structured like a properties file.  Put in the two lines above.
*** Bug 51411 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 51404 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 51441 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 51467 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I've modified the "spike" I put in for this afternoon's 4 p.m. build
(I200402101600).  I'm hoping that I'll get more useful information if this
problem keeps occurring.  Please use the debugging options, and let me know if
something appears on your console.

Possibilities:
+ The attempt to replace a tool bar contribution item with a placeholder on
dispose is failing due to an unexpected nesting of managers (see "dispose()" in
EditorActionBars).  This would be peculiar, as the problem is not consistently
reproducible.
+ Old workbench states are not being restored properly.  This would be
characterized by a decline in the frequency of occurrence with the current
"spike" in place.
+ Some timing issue (?).
+ others...?

Created an attachment (id=7883)
Console log

I'm seeing debug output on the console using I20040212-0800.
See attached file.  It doesn't seem to provide any further clues.

Nick: could you please attach the contents of your "workbench.xml" plug-in
preferences file?  I'm curious to see if you have duplicate items as listed in
Bug 51783.

The replace method grabs the first matching contribution item.  If there are
multiple contribution items, then it might leave the disposed contribution item
in the list and pull out a live one.

This would be easy to fix by making the replace method more robust.  It could
pull all matching contribution items, and replace with a single one.

This still leaves the question as to how the duplicates arise in the first place.

I'm bumping this to M8.  This bug has been sufficiently stabilized for M7, but a
complete understanding of the problem is necessary sometime before 3.0.
*** Bug 51002 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=7889)
My workbench.xml

Yep.  Lots of duplicates, of both placeholders and toolbar contributions.

I've fixed up the ContributionManager.replaceItem code so that it scans for 
duplicates and removes them.  I've also added some more debugging information 
tied into the toolbarDisposal flag. 
 
It is no longer possible to trigger this NPE, and there are measures to 
control tool bar contribution item duplication. 
 
I'll keep this bug open to see if more information comes in.

Created an attachment (id=8562)
Workbench.xml generating duplicate warnings

Using I20030310, I'm seeing the following on startup.
Attached is my workbench.xml.

Not loading duplicate cool bar item: group.file
Not loading duplicate cool bar item: org.eclipse.ui.workbench.file
Not loading duplicate cool bar item: additions
Not loading duplicate cool bar item: group.nav
Not loading duplicate cool bar item: org.eclipse.ui.workbench.navigate
Not loading duplicate cool bar item: group.editor

Nick, those statements are normal when running with the tool bar disposal 
tracing option turned on.

It looks like this code has become stable, as no one has seen these 
NullPointerExceptions since this code has been made more robust.  
Unfortunately, I don't believe I ever truly understood what was going wrong. 
 
I will investigate further in M9 -- time permitting.

Unfortunately, I don't have more time to investigate.  I will close this bug as 
WORKSFORME.  Please re-open if you have problems with this again....
Moving to verified to get them out of my list of bugs to verify for M9.
